edu.cornell.gdiac.starstruck.Obstacles

Class Rope

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cornell.gdiac.starstruck.Obstacles.Obstacle
      • edu.cornell.gdiac.starstruck.Obstacles.ComplexObstacle
        • edu.cornell.gdiac.starstruck.Obstacles.Rope

  • public class Rope
extends ComplexObstacle
    A bridge with planks connected by revolute joints. Note that this class returns to static loading. That is because there are no other subclasses that we might loop through.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Rope

        public Rope(float x,
            float y,
            float width,
            float lwidth,
            float lheight,
            AstronautModel avatar,
            AstronautModel avatar2)
        Creates a new rope bridge at the given position. This bridge is straight horizontal. The coordinates given are the position of the leftmost anchor.
        Parameters:
        x - The x position of the left anchor
        y - The y position of the left anchor
        width - The length of the bridge
        lwidth - The plank length
        lheight - The bridge thickness
        avatar - avatar
        avatar2 - avatar2

      • Rope

        public Rope(float x0,
            float y0,
            float x1,
            float y1,
            float lwidth,
            float lheight)
        Creates a new rope bridge with the given anchors.
        Parameters:
        x0 - The x position of the left anchor
        y0 - The y position of the left anchor
        x1 - The x position of the right anchor
        y1 - The y position of the right anchor
        lwidth - The plank length
        lheight - The bridge thickness

      • stretched

        public boolean stretched(float dt,
                         int c)
        The rope is stretched if a joint of the rope has a reaction force greater than 10. 0 = avatar1's side 2 = middle of rope 1 = avatar 2's side 3 = all three
        Returns:
        True if rope is completely stretched, false otherwise

      • toJson

        public com.badlogic.gdx.utils.JsonValue toJson()
        Write this astronaut to a JsonValue. When parsed, this JsonValue should return the same astronaut.
        Returns:
        A JsonValue representing this AstronautModel.
